e: Hard Charger
Flow Goer
Crowd Pleaser
Deep Thinker
When I am in Flow, I am most often...
Pushing myself to my limit / In a high stimulation environment
Connected to my body
In a crowd with friends
Someplace quiet and reflective
I value Flow most because it...
fuels my highest achievements
lets me feel like I'm at one with everything that's happening
lets me share amazing moments with others
inspires me to solve challenges creatively
I find Flow when…
my heart's beating, adrenaline's pumping and it's make or break time
everything's beautiful and effortless--things happen perfectly
we're all swept up in the moment together and feel connected to something bigger than ourselves
hours go by and I lose myself in my work and come up with something amazing
I find myself in Flow most often…
in a high stakes environments alone or with a tight crew
in serene settings where I feel connected to something bigger than myself
with people so we can build off each other's energy
when I'm alone and deeply focused or in deep conversation with like minds
My primary way to get into Flow is…
challenging my body or career to its fullest
bringing my body and mind into balance
making and sharing experiences with friends
engaging my mind to create and solve things
If I could take my dream Flow training course, it might be called:
Flow Big or Go Home: How to Huck Huge in the Zone
Flow: The Secret to Universal Awareness
Flow: How Peak Experiences Create Social Bonding
Flow: Harnessing Creativity for Your Next Breakthrough
The main reason I value Flow is...
It helps me thrive in high-stress environments
It helps me develop my spiritual awareness
It gives me access to connections I don't normally have
It gives me access to information I don't normally have
My Essential Flow Hacking Gear:
A dancefloor, stage or dinner table
A mat (altar and incense optional)
A board (must slide or roll)
A creative canvas (digital or actual)
The word that I most associate with my path to Flow is
Intensity
Serenity [Peace]
Intimacy
Insight
s: If I had to choose between Being and Doing, I'd pick...
Doing––If I wasn't moving I'd go crazy
Being––I'm happiest in peace and quiet
